com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCTextBindingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBaseBindingData
      • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBaseTextBindingData
        • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCTextBindingData

  • public class YRCTextBindingData
extends YRCBaseTextBindingData
    Instances of this class provide binding, behavioral and name information about text controls.
    Usage: For binding a text box one has to create an instance of the class YRCTextBindingData. Structure of a sample model used for input: <Orders> <Order OrderNo="1001" OrderStatus="Created"/> </Orders> //Create a binding object that has to be associated with a control. YRCTextBindingData oTxtData = new YRCTextBindingData(); //Set the name of the control. The control name should be unique. oTxtData.setName("txtStatus"); //Set the target binding. By setting the target binding we can use the value in the text box to populate //the entries in the corresponding model. oTxtData.setTargetBinding("/Order/@ChangedStatus"); //Set the source binding. The control will display the value that is present in the model (created using //the behavior object). oTxtData.setSourceBinding("/Orders/Order/@OrderStatus"); * //Finally set the binding data on the control. The key used is: YRCConstants.YRC_TEXT_BINDING_DEFINATION txtStatus.setData(YRCConstants.YRC_TEXT_BINDING_DEFINATION, oTxtData);

      • YRCTextBindingData

        public YRCTextBindingData(YRCFieldExtension fieldExtension,
                          java.util.HashMap setDataMap)
        Creates and returns a new instance of YRCTextBindingData. This constructor is used to get binding data for field extensions.
        Parameters:
        fieldExtension - The field extension for which data needs to be created.
        setDataMap - The data attributes map.

      • YRCTextBindingData

        public YRCTextBindingData()
        Default constructor of the binding data. Creates an instance of the binding object populated with the default values, if applicable.

      • isDBLocalized

        public boolean isDBLocalized()
        Returns:
        true if the data has to be localized using database, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setDBLocalized(boolean)

      • setDBLocalized

        public void setDBLocalized(boolean isLocalized)
        Boolean to populate the text control using the db localizd string.
        Parameters:
        isLocalized - Pass true if the text box has to be populated using db localized string. By default iit is set to false.
        See Also:
        YRCPlatformUI.getDBString(String)

      • getDataType

        public java.lang.String getDataType()
        Returns:
        The data type of the control if the data type is not controlled by target binding.

      • setDataType

        public void setDataType(java.lang.String dataTypeName)
        Set the datatype to be used for validating the text control.

        Note: Usage of this method should be used in special cases only. The datatype can be derived from either, the target or source binding specified for the binding pbject. Only when the one needs to override the derived datatype from binding, this method be used.

      • setFile

        public void setFile(boolean isFile)
        This method should be used to set the type of the field to "true" for file upload. This indicates that the field value is the location of the file which needs to get uploaded.
        Parameters:
        isFile - is "true" if the field is being used for file upload

      • isFile

        public boolean isFile()
        This method returns true if the field is being used is "file" type being used to upload file.
        Returns:
        true if textbox is a "file" type, false otherwise.

      • setFileUploadTable

        public void setFileUploadTable(java.lang.String tableName)
        This utility method should be used for file uploads. This indicates the file validations for maximum allowed size and and file types which will be allowed file upload is table specific, given by the table name.
        Parameters:
        tableName - is the name of the table which specifies the maximum allowed size and allowed file types for a file uploaded.

      • getFileUploadTable

        public java.lang.String getFileUploadTable()
        Method to set back end table name, which is the parent table name of file Attachment table
        Returns:
        fileUploadTable

      • getFileUploadType

        public java.lang.String getFileUploadType()
        Method to get the file upload type which can be ONSELECT or ONSUBMIT. ONSELECT indicates the file needs to be uploaded as soon as the file is registered . ONSUBMIT indicates the file will have to be uploaded to the server before API which persists the File in DB is called
        Returns:
        file upload type

      • setFileUploadType

        public void setFileUploadType(java.lang.String fileUploadType)
        Method to set the file upload type.By default the upload type is ONSELECT.
        Parameters:
        fileUploadType - can be ONSELECT or ONSUBMIT

      • isModelUpdateDynamic

        public boolean isModelUpdateDynamic()
        Method to indicate if the model update will be handled by the application and/or a single text control is used to upload files for multiple entities
        Returns:
        true if the model update performed is by the application

      • setModelUpdateDynamic

        public void setModelUpdateDynamic(boolean modelUpdateDynamic)
        Method to indicate if the model update will be handled by the application and/or a single text control is used to upload files for multiple entities
        Parameters:
        modelUpdateDynamic - true if the model update is performed by the application
